author: gregnagy
content:
Is there a canonical list of light client implementations and approaches?

What I have found so far
- eth2/consensus LC based: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/tree/dev/specs/altair/light-client
  - https://github.com/lightclients/kevlar
  - https://github.com/a16z/helios
  - https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/tree/unstable/packages/light-client
- LES based light clients and ultra light clients
  - I haven't found any specific client that implements this 
  - Afaik this is broken since the merge 
  - this model has issues around incentives/compensations â€” why would a node spend resources to serve these requests 
- p2p based solution aka portal network 
  - My understanding is that it's still very much in research state 
  - https://nimbus.team/docs/fluffy.html
  - https://github.com/ethereum/trin
  - https://github.com/ethereumjs/ultralight

Are there any other categories that I am missing? 
Is there any official documentation about these efforts? (If not would it make sense to put effort into creating one?)
https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/nodes-and-clients/#light-node - I have read this page, helped understanding the very basics but after that it took me bit of time to understand how these releate to each other.
